controlled_vocabulary.comment: This table provides the restricted vocabulary for the column type in the table Protocol and is used to give a high-level cut as to which of the manipulations in the array and sample prep processes is being described
The elements of this controlled vocabulary are encoded in the curation tool. They regulate the sub-setting of which protocol entries are displayed in the protocol screen.

term.name: growth
term.description: protocol relates to growth conditions for the organism, such as temperature, pH, light and nutrients

term.name: rna_prep
term.description: protocol relates to how the target RNA sample was prepared, such as phenol or guanidinium extraction

term.name: tissue_or_sample
term.description: protocol describes the particular tissue or cell type isolated for the RNA extraction

term.name: cdna_and_labeling
term.description: protocol relates to how the cDNA was made from RNA, and labeled

term.name: hybridization
term.description: protocol relates to how the target and probe interaction was manipulated for stringency and kinetics

term.name: other_protocol
term.description: protocols that describe less general procedures such as oligo manufacture and QC, slide or filter preparation etc
